body: As part of the ECOFED project, I helped develop automated strategies for migrating complex cloud-native applications between Cloud Service Providers with minimal downtime.
In collaboration with consortium partners, I contributed to Kubernetes stack migrations and spearheaded real-time PostgreSQL replication, supporting open European cloud standards.
Developed a secure web-based system to digitize and streamline the monthly timesheet approval process for Info Support consultants and their clients.

The platform allows consultants to modify, group, and share statements for digital approval, ensuring data security and improving the user experience and time investment by simplifying the approval process.
As a lead developer at Author-e, I played a key role in delivering efficient and maintainable software solutions for diverse business clients.
I architected new systems, maintained existing solutions, and collaborated closely with stakeholders to align solutions with evolving business needs.
Led a research team to develop an AI-driven method for detecting and notifying malicious network behavior in cloud environments of SUE clients.
Built on research papers from TU Delft and innovative transformer models to analyze networking logs and enhance cloud security response.

VocabVersus is a web-based multiplayer game where players submit words containing a prescribed set of letters. Points are awarded based on word complexity, speed, and rarity. Initially an engagement tool for schools, it has evolved into a competitive game for all.
The application minimizes client-server delay, with a dynamic scoring system that rewards rare words. Cloud-hosted and using Lucene and SignalR, it ensures scalability and cost efficiency.

Developed a web-based 3D printing solution for PodoPrinter’s own line of 3D printers. The platform features a cloud slicer, model analysis tools, and remote printing capabilities, enabling global access, enhancing usability, and supporting a secure cloud infrastructure.
Enabling PodoPrinter to expand into a broader global market.
Led the development of a machine learning model to predict optimal travel times for Jugo consultants, improving productivity and reducing environmental impact.
The project involved extensive data analysis and explored the integration of AI-driven solutions within the company.
Collaborated with a talented team to create a fully automated license management system for Stuurmen/OneBlinq’s design tool plugins.
The system streamlined license delivery, integrated with their webshop, and ensured scalability, reliability, and customer engagement through trial management.
Worked closely with a team to develop an internal support ticketing system for BAS Trucks, later BAS World.
The system significantly streamlined internal processes and was ultimately chosen over competing implementations as the preferred organization-wide solution, improving operational efficiency.
